Articles.Content:
I FOUND THE ANSWER!

OOPS! WRONG CHEMICAL!

OH FU-

Not that. Looks like a cool game though.

Reposting on new page,

Making light of tragedy, making mere numbers of patient art and science, a grid at times in a grid in a grid. For many the answer's close at hand, while some must travel near or far, but however long it takes I hope you keep smiling.

Clue 1: The solution is something I'm very confident everyone in the thread, indeed virtually everyone on KSP forums, has heard of.

Not that. Looks like a cool game though.

The Game is Civilization V

Oh yeah!

DANNY2462
Good guess, but no. Nor any other Sim City.

Not that. Looks like a cool game though.

Reposting on new page,

Making light of tragedy, making mere numbers of patient art and science, a grid at times in a grid in a grid. For many the answer's close at hand, while some must travel near or far, but however long it takes I hope you keep smiling.

Clue 1: The solution is something I'm very confident everyone in the thread, indeed virtually everyone on KSP forums, has heard of.

is it graphing paper?
Not graph paper - superseded by my second clue anyway. Not minecraft.
super, neither. i already said it's a computer game
Happiness? I say that because of that last line.

Is it Minesweeper?

DINGDINGDING!

Making light of tragedy, - it's a game about fricking landmines

making mere numbers - the way the game works

of patient art and science, - real demining

a grid at times in a grid in a grid. - the first grid is the one in the game. the second is the cube-farm office you might be playing it in, and the third is the city that office might be in

For many the answer's close at hand, while some must travel near or far, - if you're reading this on your PC and you have Minesweeper installed it's right there. If you're not, say you're browsing the forums on a smartphone, you might have to go to another room or even across town to get to play it.

but however long it takes - reference to the game being a timewaster, and the scoring is based on time too

I hope you keep smiling. - the face in the classic windows version, it keeps smiling when things are fine
Argh, that makes total sense now. Why are these riddles so hard, lately?

Sweet! Give me a few minutes to come up with one that cantab won't get immediately.

Edit:

Six in parallel but none the same

An item for playing but not really a game

Some use me for work or to woo a mate

But most people use me to recreate

I work well with others but sometimes alone

In someone's arms is my natural home

I can be quite cheap or cost much treasure

But the person that holds me determines the pleasure.

Edited October 15, 2014 by Red Iron Crown
Now with 100% more riddle.

Yeah...that's just setting off my dirty mind.

Edit: Wait, is it a computer keyboard?
